attributes.action: Reverse the Decision to Scrap the Gender Recognition Act Consultation Results
attributes.additional_details: Only 1 in 132 people are trans and therefore one of the smallest group of people that experience a disproportionate level of discrimination and violence in the uk, along with mental health this can compound issues to a breaking point. We want a means to help this very small subset of people to be treated equally as everyone else. The consultation was overwhelmingly in support of trans people, these results need to be carried out  and new guidelines applied as promised.
attributes.background: We demand that you provide Acts and Laws based on information in regards to the individuals who exist, look into further protections and ways to provide help to a very vulnerable subset of people in the community, and provide better protections and rights to those people.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Require schools and colleges to have gender neutral toilets:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302997

Uphold current legal protections for transgender individuals and under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

Do not ban gender transition treatments for under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318025

Add gender identity to the characteristics protected under the Equality Act 2010:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301138

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934

Allow for a gender neutral option on a passport, such as an "X":
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301083
